alert.note: Alert for Coffee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued December 18 at 1:29PM CST until December 18 at 2:00PM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southeastern Coffee County in southeastern Alabama... * Until 200 PM CST. * At 128 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 8 miles southwest of New Brockton, or 10 miles southeast of Elba, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Enterprise and New Brockton around 150 PM CST. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Shell Army Field, Goodman, Turner Crossroads, Clintonville and Enterprise Municipal A/P. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
